definition: pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])

sentences.english: In addition, thermal pads were placed on the inner face of the mid-plane to conduct heat away from the main chips.
sentences.chinese: 此外，熱墊被放在了中面內面進行從主芯片熱量帶走。

sentences.english: Select the best glazing or light polishing pad to be used with your buffer.
sentences.chinese: 選擇最好的玻璃或光拋光墊被使用與您的緩衝區。

sentences.english: Select the best polishing pad to be used with your buffer.
sentences.chinese: 選擇最好的拋光墊被使用與您的緩衝區。
